isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - PRO SLEEPER ELECTRICAL SYSTEM - LIGHTING, ACCESSORIES AND TRAILER SOCKET - SLEEPER AND LUGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHTS

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to circuit diagram on , for the following discussion.

B2 battery stud supplies power (key On or Off) through 20A fuse F8-D and cab/sleeper connector (473), to operate the sleeper bunk fluorescent and reading lights as well as the luggage compartment lights.

svcsubproc.title: Reading Lights
svcsubproc.para: Refer to circuit diagram on for the following discussion.
The reading lights have an internal switch and are grounded through sleeper/cab connector (472) at cab ground adapter (454).

svcsubproc.title: Bunk Fluorescent Light
svcsubproc.para: Refer to circuit diagram on for the following discussion.

The bunk fluorescent light receives power at all times from B2 battery stud, through fuse F8-D. The ground side of the light has three switches, enabling the light to be turned On or Off from three different locations. Toggling any of the two position switches, will either close (light ON) or open (light OFF) the ground path for the fluorescent light at cab ground adapter (454)

step1.para: The fluorescent light assembly has an internal switch on the ground side.
Bunk Dome light switch (594) is located on the sleeper control panel.
Sleeper Dome Light switch (502) is located at the header panel above the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: Luggage Compartment Lights
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to circuit diagram on
for the following discussion.

The luggage compartment lights receive power at all times from B2 battery stud, through fuse F8-D. The right and left luggage compartment light circuits have a mercury switch attached to the door, that closes the feed circuit when the door is open to power the light. The ground path for the luggage lights is through cab ground adapter (454).
